noun.description: The strength and robustness of the chemical binding between a dye or pigment and a material to which it is directly applied.
The persistence of effect or retention on the skin, hair, etc., of any topically applied cosmetic or medicinal preparation, as sunscreen, shampoo, etc.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Schoolcraft (1793–1864). From substantive + -ity. Compare post-classical Latin substantivitas.
